algorithm_technique: Build a Trie with reversed words. Sum lengths of words corresponding to leaf nodes.
problem_summary_simple: Find the shortest string that can encode a list of words by using suffixes.
problem_summary_technical: Utilize a Trie to store reversed words; leaf nodes represent unique suffixes. Sum lengths of words ending at leaf nodes.
key_insights: Encoding words by their suffixes means we only need to store words that are not suffixes of other words.
A Trie is ideal for this as it naturally groups words with common suffixes (when reversed).
Words that end up at leaf nodes in the Trie (after reversing) are the ones that must be explicitly encoded.
